intro: Orthosiphon glabratus var. africanus, commonly known as African horsebean, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or purple, and it produces lens-shaped seeds within small pods. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
